Description: Ostracon, large fragment (two of four pieces) of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large, with two lines of cord-marked decoration beneath.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393233) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393233)
